Thanks Tom and Moses. I was quoting more in part from what I had been taught, ( I guess there is a lot of different information out there ) I was also reading in a Tsuba book ( I think ) about the same theory, Thinner light tsuba were in vogue when the sword was used form the Katana as apposed to the two handed technique on the ground. I will see if I can dig that information up again.

Thanks for correcting me.

Rich
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: tom helm 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, April 25, 2003 9:03 AM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba balance


        Greetings all-
  I have to agree with Moses, sometimes a heavy tsuba adds a difference 
  but I think it is more psychological than practical. Balanace is in 
  the blade the better swordsman can find it in wakizashi or a 
  nodachi...
  -t
